question: Pearson's Skewness Coefficient is given BY
exp: SKEWNESS: * Is measure of asymmetry of a probability distribution of a random variable * Measures of skewness: - - Pearson's mode or First Skewness coefficient = (Mean - Mode) /SD - - Pearson's median or second Skewness coefficient = 3 (Mean - Median) /SD - - Quaile skewness = ( Q3-2. Q2 + Q1)/Q3 - Q1

question: Standard detion is the measure of:
exp: STANDARD DETION (SD) SD is the measure of Detion from mean value. SD is most common and generally most appropriate measure of dispersion SD is defined as the 'root-mean-square (RMS) detion of the values from their mean', or as the square root of the variance SD calculation: =

question: 68% values are covered in how many Standard Detions (SD)?
exp: Normal / Gaussian curve:- Is 'bilaterally symmetrical, bell - shaped'. Mean, Median and Mode coincide. (Mean = Median = Mode) Has mean (u) = 0 and SD (s) = 1. 1) Mean +- 1. SD (u +- 1s) covers 68% values. 2) Mean +- 2. SD (u +- 2s) covers 95% values. 3) Mean +- 3. SD (u +- 2s) covers 99% values.

question: The mean of the 25 plasma volumes is 12. 5 litres. Standard detion is 0. 25. Calculate Variance:-
exp: - Standard detion = square root of variance Variance = (S. D X S. D) - Given SD = 0. 25 - Thus, Variance = 0. 25 x 0. 25 = 0. 0625

question: In a Standard detion of 2, confidence limit is
exp: Normal Curve This is a normal distribution curve in which 95% of the population falls between -2. SD and +2. SD. Confidence limits are the upper and lower boundaries of a confidence interval. Confidence interval is the interval within which a parameter value is expected to lie with ceain confidence levels, as could be revealed by repeated samples.

question: A researcher draws unbiased sample of 100 adult delhites and find that their mean weight is 72 kg with a standard detion of 1. 5. 95% of wt of delhites shall be between:
exp: In the given question, n = 100 adult Delhites, mean weight (u) = 72kg, standard detion (SD) = 1. 5 95% wt of delhites = Mean +- 2. SD (u +- 2. SD) = 72 +- 2 (1. 5) = 72 +- 3 =b/w 69 & 75 kg wt

question: Variation of Sample mean from Population mean is:
exp: Standard error: It is the variation of sample mean from population mean. Sample mean is known as statistic. Population mean is known as parameter. - Standard detion is the variation in a single value from the mean of a sample.
opc: Standard error of difference between two means
opd: Standard error of difference between two propoions

question: If the bih weight of each of the 10 babies born in a hospital in a day is found to be 2. 8 kg, then the Standard detion of this sample will be:-
exp: - Standard detion is detion of each value from the standard value. - In the given question, the bih weight of each of the 10 babies born in a hospital in a day is found to be 2. 8 kg, - standard detion of this sample, SD (s)=
